clinical_insights.journey_summary: Randall, a 64-year-old environmental lawyer, entered treatment after a significant relapse following one year of sobriety. His journey is defined by a dichotomy between high-level professional success and a self-described 'toxic' domestic environment. His relapse cycle was triggered by holiday stressors and a pattern of 'substance switching' (MDMA to Alcohol). Clinically, his journey moved from a 'hero/caretaker' role—where he sponsored six people in early sobriety while ignoring his own needs—to an emerging focus on radical self-preservation and boundary setting.
clinical_insights.behavioral_patterns: The client exhibited a 'walking on eggshells' mentality at home, leading to emotional suppression. In treatment, he began to process the resentment of being 'used' by his spouse and stepdaughter, eventually recognizing that his domestic situation was a primary barrier to long-term recovery.

severity_of_illness.withdrawal_presentation: Presented in active withdrawal with a CIWA-Ar score of 12. Physical symptoms included bilateral hand tremors, diaphoresis (profuse sweating), and facial flushing.
severity_of_illness.psychiatric_severity: BDI-II score of 20 (Moderate Depression) and BAI score of 29 (Moderate-to-High Anxiety). The client reported persistent feelings of shame, guilt, and 'caffeine headaches' related to high-stress levels.
severity_of_illness.occupational_risk: High-severity work stress, reporting 70-80 hour work weeks which acted as a primary excuse for his substance use cycle.

treatment_milestones.description: Successfully completed the 4-step Lorazepam (Ativan) taper protocol without seizures or significant complications.
Transitioned from ASAM 3.7 (Medically Monitored Detox) to ASAM 3.5 (Residential Level of Care).
Demonstrated clinical progress by maintaining healthy boundaries during a high-conflict visit with his spouse, choosing to stay in the living area for monitoring after a verbal disagreement.
Started Acamprosate (333mg) as a proactive measure for relapse prevention upon discharge.

reclamation_narrative.core_shift: The client's 'reclamation' is centered on the decision to end an emotionally abusive marriage to prioritize his own life. He shifted from a state of 'hopelessness regarding the outcome' to actively researching Sober Living Environments (SLE) in San Francisco.
reclamation_narrative.recovery_vision: Randall has reclaimed his identity as a musician (guitar) and is integrating holistic recovery tools like sound baths and mindfulness into his daily routine, moving away from the 'work-to-death' cycle.

patient_voice.on_relapse: I started up again, and I can't stop on my own. I need help.
patient_voice.on_home_life: My marriage is pretty toxic... I am walking on eggshells at home.
patient_voice.on_work: My work is not being affected; I work myself to the bone.
patient_voice.on_recovery: I am ready to transition... I feel significantly more stable.
